ranked_diseases.disease_name: Multiple self-healing squamous epithelioma, susceptibility to
ranked_diseases.explanation: Primary consideration given the presence of self-healing squamous epithelioma as the main phenotypic feature, and all three reference cases with this feature were diagnosed with this condition.
Alternative name for multiple self-healing squamous epithelioma. This autosomal dominant condition typically presents with keratoacanthoma-like lesions that spontaneously regress.
Can present with multiple self-healing squamous lesions similar to the patient's presentation, though typically more widespread and without the genetic susceptibility pattern.
Can include keratoacanthomas among its cutaneous manifestations, though typically associated with sebaceous tumors and internal malignancies which are not mentioned in this case.
Can develop multiple squamous cell carcinomas and keratoacanthoma-like lesions, though typically with photosensitivity and other neurological features not mentioned here.
